text.p: The following are top headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Ontario Municipal Affairs Minister Al Leach backs single big Toronto: Local politicians balk at idea of amalgamating borough, five cities.
- Stable immigration levels reflect backlash in Canada: Investors preferred over family class.
- Quebec Premier Lucien Bouchard bids to counter province's language split: Sovereignty not mentioned as economic renewal stressed.
- Nazis' goes on block in Austria: Art sale closes Holocaust chapter.
- Chippewas cash in on casino gamble: Poor U.S. tribe that risked jail for running blackjack tables has used its money to build a major business operation.
- New bidder for mutual fund company Altamira sought: Shareholder trying to fend off Manulife takeover.
- Canadian government issues wireless cable licences: Services planned by three companies will create alternative to local telephone, cable TV, government says.
- School buses to get advertising: Boards in Ontario, Alberta see lucrative revenue potential.
- Inmet Mining Corp takes massive writedown: New CEO's action shocks Bay Street.
- Manulife takes control at mutual fund company Altamira, seeks more control.
- Phone and cable rival is born: Ottawa gives OK to 'third force' technology to take on giant communications firms.
